page.title: 12Eversley Sheltered Housing
page.content: { Paul's Field}was built in 1973 by the local council to provide housing for elderly people who can take care of themselves but who may occasionally need help. We spoke to Mrs. Hunt, the warden, who has been there for eight years. There are fourteen flats and three bungalows. The residents' ages range from sixty-seven to eighty-nine. The flats consist of a lounge, kitchen, bedroom, sitting-room and bathroom. Each flat has an alarm and an intercom system for talking to Mrs. Hunt, who is on call twenty-four hours a day. There is a pleasant communal room where the residents can meet for parties, bingo, or a song-song round the piano. Mrs. Hunt does shopping and collects pensions for the residents, as well as looking after them when they are ill.
